cause.description:
DEPT.OF SOCIAL SERVICES about solutions to problems like homelessness, violent police officers and high-polluting cars. All three problems follow a power-law distribution when plotted statistically on a graph…
http://www.newyorker.com/archive/2006/02/13/060213fa_fact
Which is to say - these are problems we can solve - and it could cost less $money$ than allowing them to continue as is...
http://www.homelessconnectminneapolis.org/
one way to help is to volunteer...
another way is to simply be conscious of these issues, and act with compassion towards those you've not found the same fortunes you have...
p.s. some people like not having to pay rent... it should not be illegal to be homeless...
1. homelessness is draining unneccessary money from the public coffers
2. police are spending time on homelessness that could be better utilized elsewhere
3. WE have the power to change this.
cause.mission: end homelessness (for those that want a home)...
cause.name: End Homelessness
